My first experience with Dead by Daylight...

I was playing with one friend in a private match so we could get a feel for the game. It took a few minutes but I found him.

I chased him down and hit him once, and on the second hit I managed to get teleported into a brick wall on the complete opposite side of the map.

Upon this happening I checked the steam store wondering if this game was still in early access.

It wasn't.

This game used to be so much fun, but it's slowing getting harder and harder to play. I keep playing because I have an addiction to earning bloodpoints. I've been playing on and off since the release year and nowadays I choose other games to play because even though I love DBD the constant bugs and the bad servers can make playing extremely frustrating. I never play alone anymore, that's if I do decide to launch the game. 
If you don't know anyone you can play with, i wouldn't buy it.
I recommend because it can be fun at times and it's addictive.

Dead by Daylight представляет собой уникальную и очень атмосферную игру (из альтернатив разве что грядущая Friday the 13th: The Game и серия кривоватеньких игр на основе Slender: Slendytubbies, Survivers и т.д.). Если вжиться в роль, то можно испытать целый спектр эмоций...

This is an amazing game that is definetly worth a buy. A little expensive but if you can get it on sale definetly buy it.

I wouldn't say its a horror game, though you get a couple scares out of it, I would say it is more suspensful. Hearing the ambient noises, mixed with the survivors getting hurt and the killer's attacks make you sit up in your chair. The games last around 10 minutes each.

Pros:
-Playable for a long time
-Gives a couple of scares
-Well made
-Fun

Cons:
-Killer hosts, gives them an advantage (can't tell you how many times I've been Tracer)
-Wait time to be killer is around 10 minutes
-Couple of bugs
-Hard to play with friends on online mode, haven't added queueing with friends yet.

tal vez no tenga una historia detrás, pero este juego es muuuuy bueno para pasar el rato con tus amigos en partidas privadas o sobreviviendo con desconocidos para subir tus  niveles. Este juego lo compre para ponerme en el papel de un sobreviviente y realmente se siente así. Como asesino solo jugué en privadas, no me acostumbro aún. Si eres fan del suruvivor horror, te gusta el suspenso y tu y tus amigos tienen para conseguir este juego, háganlo, es una buena inversión. O puedes esperar a alguna rebaja, lo malo, los jugadores veteranos tenfrán mucho más ventaja que tú, ya sean sobrevivientes o asesinos.
Un punto malo, hay tramposos metiendose al online con conocicdos para subir de nivel siendo uno el asesino y el otro sobreviviente. Yo entré con un amigo, pero ambos como sobrevivientes, y fue genial tener a alguien conocido sobreviviendo, pero solo eso, nada de trampas (duramos 2 min xD).
非常有臨常感

关于游戏本身
表面上是恐怖游戏，本质上是一个花式躲猫猫游戏，所以并不特别恐怖
游戏性很足，玩的时候十分刺激。并且总有再来一把的冲动
音效满分，绝对是这个游戏的亮点；高画质精美，但优化问题太严重
匹配机制要死，我第一次玩游戏（7月4日，1.0.2）选的屠夫，就匹配到40级2段的生还者，一个人都没击倒过就被拆光所有架子，打开所有电机，崩溃

9/10 Exteremely fun game, Not only horrifying as a solo player but with a group of 5 it can be hilariously entertaining!
It's not often I get a good jump scare from a video game but this one sure delivers. Also with solo play/randomly generated maps you always have a new experience during each round!
Don't let a few glitches here an there and a lack of party system throw you off. There will be updates to come fixing that and then this game will be a perfect 10/10 for me.

As fun as this game was when i were finally able to get into a game with my friend in public, and might i mention that those were the only times that playing the game was actually really fun, there are so many flaws and bugs in this game, that whenever you go in a game, and this is without exaggerating, there's a 50% chance that you'll encounter some sort of bug in the game that either gets you killed or leaves you frustrated as to why people are charging money for this severely underdeveloped game.

It's very clear that this game TRIED to focus on some sort of fair-ish gameplay and almost competetive-ish like gameplay between the killer and the survivors.
The reason i'm emphazising "TRIED", is because it miserably fails at it and is left half way while combining the worst of both worlds.

I'd like to go more into detail as to why i feel this way, but honestly... there's so much wrong with this game, and so very little that's right with this game for me to even start.

To sum it up:

After a few matches, you'll start to get the feeling that this game is still in the very early beta stage, which in all honesty, i think it actually is and that the developers all know that it is as well. The only reason it's released is because we as consumers, have ridiculously low standards.

If you're okay with the way the game is set up and you're in it with a more...competitive manner in mind, then you'll be disappointed (unless you're lucky) seeing as they're constantly trying to shove unfair advantages down our throats by encouraging us to use addons/offerings every single game, and which ones you get ofcourse is completely random, meaning that the outcome of a game more or less depends on how lucky you were when you opened up your blood tree.

The fact that you're not even able to  group up with your friends to play online is ridiculous. People who have played it might try to bring up the argument of "HURR DEY R TRYIN 2 MEK IT FEIR SO SURVIVURS CENT COMMUNICET DURR", okay, so what you're saying is that they're focusing on fairness between the Survivors and the Killer? Which is then contradicted by the fact that this game relies HEAVILY on how lucky you are with the perks you're able to purchase in the blood tree.
Imagine a team of survivor and just 1 of them having the sprint perk, and the Killer's been unlucky with his blood tree, and he has something like Deerstalker.. Yea no, that one guy, he's gone, don't matter if you on his ass, he gone.
Oor a team of survivors with a perk like "HURR WE CEN SEE DUH BEAR TREPS WITHIN 2 METUR REDIUS", while their killer is someone like the Wraith with the crow perk, yea no, they're all fucked. Every single Survivor? Yea, dead. Just dead.


I mean... one positive is if you actually have an abundance of friends with this game and at least 3 of them are ready to play 24/7... then yes, by all means, it's only like 20 bucks or something, and you'll probably have a good time.
If you DON'T have 50 friends with this game, then skip skip skip, save your money for drugs and alcohol and your next door stripper
SICCKK GAME I LOVE IT  PLS BUY AND SUPPORT THIS STUDIO. SICK. (this was not sarcasm, really buy it)

ok

I absolutely adore this game.

Despite the rather repetitive gameplay, it is the first game on Steam that I have ever obtained 1000 hours on.

It has its fair share of issues. Every game does.

The most notable that I can think of is:

- Peer to Peer matchmaking. If the killer has bad internet, the survivors suffer instead.
- Balance. Killers are generally considered to be weak in the overall state of the game.
- Toxic community. It has one of the most toxic communties I have seen, more so then CSGO, Left 4 Dead and Rainbow Six Siege.


One thing that I can commend is the developer's attitude to the game. They're not the best devs in the world, but it is extremely obvious that they care greatly for the game and its community.

9/10. Solid.

It's a fun game, but:

- Currently the game connections lag just enough to cause it to be frustrating.  
- So many bugs / crashes that you will need to restart the game or force quit from task manager frequently.
- You can kill 3/4 of the survivors and still lose the match (despite it being called a ruthless victory), which can feel very disappointing. (as killer)
- If you don't get your RNG to get Iron Grip early on, you will eventually be met with games where you have only basement hooks, and no way to bring anyone to them, leaving you at a disadvantage for sacrificing players. (as killer)

Once those points are addressed, the game will be much better, and this review will be updated.

Ich will mal dem Negativ Feedback hier Beine machen und genauer auf das Spiel eingehen.
Zunächst: Für Freunde der Scare Games eine klare Kaufempfehlung. Das Spiel hat alles was man braucht um "Freundschaften zu zerstören :D"
Auch das man mal als Mörder ran finde ich Persönlich ziemlich genial.

Es gibt jede Menge Killer und Überlebende die man Spielen kann jeder einzelne Charakter ist dabei Einzigartig von seinen Perks die er sich aus dem Blutnetz holen kann.
Es herrscht eine ziemliche ausgewogenheit zwischen Killer und Survivor niemand wird benachteiligt.

Mit freunden macht das Spielt noch mehr Spaß. So könnt ihr euch untereinander absprechen und euch viel einfacher im Game bewegen.
Eure gegner werden härter mit fallendem “Überlebenden Rang”. Am Anfang jeder Saison stehen alle Spieler bei Rang 20 und müssen / können sich auf Rang 1 nach unten Arbeiten. Der Rang ist abhängig von der Leistung im Spiel. Um im Rang nicht abzusteigen benötigt man mindestens 10.000 Blutpunkte. Diese sind aber einfach erspielt insofern man nicht am anfang der Runde drauf geht.

Ein nervenkitzel löst die Musik im Spiel aus die auch mir immer noch Herzflattern bereitet wenn ich kurz davor stehe zu entkommen und alle anderen Tot sind oder wenn ich vom Killer verfolgt werde.
 
Sollte man frisch ins Spiel einsteigen rät sich: Übung macht den Meister. Das ihr am anfang wohl mehr verliert als Gewinnt ist klar. Sich zu Opfern oder geschnappt zu werden ist nicht unbedingt schlimm. Voraussetzung ist das ihr in der Runde bereits genügend Aktionen getätigt habt die euch Punkte einbringen. 

Merke also: Auch wenn ich nicht entkomme, kann ich im Rang “aufsteigen” bzw Absteigen da Levensystem 20 (niedrigste)  -> 1 (höchste) .


Mein Fazit aus dem Game:
Es eignet sich perfekt für schöne Runden mit Freunden aber auch allein. Ich hatte schon viel spaß dabei den Killer zu trollen oder vor ihm wegzulaufen. Das Spiel bereitet manchmal gut Nervenkitzel und das liebe ich. Dabei stellt Dead by Daylight aber auch Games wie Friday the 13th in den schatten, denn das Spiel ist noch lange nicht so scary wie DBD.

Support Erfahrungen:
Sehr gut! Solltet ihr ein Problem haben seit ihr da auf jeden fall gut aufgehoben. Die Jungs versuchen alles euch zu helfen.

buenisimo,  tanto ser el superviviente o el asesino.

after the 2.6.0 update a lot has changed in the fog. one of the biggest and most anticipated changes was to the perk "decisive strike" which was one of the most unfun perks to ever go against. reworking this perk has been needed since 2016 and it has been strong ever since it came out, however, instead of reworking it into a new fresh and fun perk the decided to gut it and make it not even worth running on fun builds. now the perks requires you to get focused when you get removed from the hook and gives you a free escape if they choose to pick you up during the sixty second window. the issue is that the will more often then not happen in a match and you will just be left on the ground for sixty seconds. I was hoping for the perk to get a rework like alert or calm spirit giving you a nice advantage in some situations while being fun to use. 

The new ranking system isnt for me. it requires you to carry your team as survivor or play super aggressive as killer in order to rank up. in this update you now need to get three emblems iridescent emblems and one bronze, this is asking drastically too much if you are with or against competent survivors. the best way to illustrate this is from the survivor side as survivors have 4 people COMPETING instead of working together in order to rank up. in order to get iridescent lightbringer you need to repair 2.7 generators to get a iridescent emblem, this works out to having to work on generators for about 3.6 minutes of the match. in order to get iridescent unbroken you need to not go down once in the match. to get a iridescent  benevolent you need to get 3 saves and 1 full heal on a survivor, if none of your team goes down you will only get a bronze emblem. last but not least is the evader emblem, to achieve iridescent in this you need to run the killer around for about 3.5 minutes. keep in mind if the killer downs you you will not be able to achieve your iridescent in unbroken. so in total to rank up you will most likely need to: repair 3 generators, run the killer for 4 minutes, save 3 people and do a bit of team healing and then because you probably got down in the chase get a gold-silver in unbroken. the thing that makes this hard is that while going for saves you can not do gens, while being chased you cant do gens, while doing gens you cant go for saves or be chased. while you are working on one of these your team is probably doing gens or getting saves also meaning that you are on a clock to do all of this before your team does.

killer is also awful right now (i am a nurse main so there will be some bias). instead of being allowed to finish games quick to rank up the killer needs to be able to find a way to slow the game down.  killers also need 3 iridescent and one bronze in order to pip. the first emblem "gatekeeper" has you gain points towards it for however long generators are not powered you gain 1 point per second with a multiplier based on how many gens are up (5 = 100, 4 = 80 3 = 60 2 = 45 1 = 35) and you need to get 55 000 points in order to get an iridescent. this emblem however is nice because if you kill everyone without a single generator being done you will get an iridescent regardless, you will most of the time never get this if you are not playing nurse because killers are simply too slow to manage this feat. Devout will give you an iridescent if you kill all 4 survivors, once again this is hard to do unless you are playing a meta killer on the survivors underestimate you. malicious is the worst offender, this emblem gives you 1 point each time you hit a survivor and two points each time they reach a new hook state, you need 36 points in order to get an iridescent. this emblem is difficult because you loose 1 point whenever a survivor heals. meaning you need to get 4 kills and not let them heal in order to score an iridescent. chaser is the last emblem for killer. this one works similar to evader for survivors as it is all about the chase. you need to get 2550 points in order to get an iridescent. points are awarded for fining a survivor (5 points) hitting a survivor (55 points per hit) if a survivor is downed within if seconds of the chase you will gain 90 points, if the chase ends withing 30 you get 60 points, 45 = 50 59 = 40 and over a minute will give you thirty points.  so in a match to pip i need to: not leg one generator be done or grind out the game, get 4 kills, slug and let survivors save to get points toward my chaser emblem and then score a bronze - silver in malicious.

As much as i agree that the rank system needs to be more challenging i do not agree with needing to compete with teammates you play like there's a gun to my heat as killer. having to run strong builds each game is not fun, what if you want to try and rank up with off meta perks, sometimes as survivor you don't have a choice to rank up. you team will farm saves leaving you with only a bronze benevolent and if you get downed you will loose you iridescent unbroken making a rankup point impossible. what if you have a 4 man voice chat group who rushes your generators meaning you don't get your gatekeeper emblem. overall if you want to get to higher ranks you need to play perfectly and hope your team slacks off or in killer's case, hope that the survivors eat chalk.

also the new matchmaking system is a joke (45 minute killer ques with people out of your rank) :)

Good game


got more bugs than gaben's butt crack

Dead by Daylight, where the points don't matter and bugs are marked as features. 

It is impossible to actually win against a killer if they know what they are doing. I've played plenty of hours on both sides now and it's just way too tuned in their favor. From the burnables to the very core mechanics of the game, inserting the killers as the host of the match ensures they will get hits that are questionable at best in the survivor perspective. The only time anybody lives against a killer who know what they are doing is if the killer allows it or if someone steals hatch (which is also something the killer could block if they want). I love asymmetric games but even the best teams of survivors can't outplay a good killer. Maybe when dedicated servers become a thing and killers can no longer hit through obstacles will there be a chance for the survivors to win because of skill and teamwork rather than just getting lucky or being allowed to leave.

As much as I love this game and will still play it despite its flaws, I can't recommend it due to the sheer fact that even after all this time that it's been around they still haven't fixed these glaring issues

Decided to rewrite my review for the Last Breath update. The game was almost perfectly balanced before this patch. Now it's 1 sided as all hell. The devs are fucking stupid as hell and made a killer that can teleport through walls and in the open to catch and HIT you during their teleportation. They have also done nothing to fix performance and netcode issues. I have a PC that's more that able to run this game at max settings but I am forced to play on all low due to the very unstable FPS. The net code is the classic UE4 bs where there is a HUGE difference between where you are compared to where you are on the killers screen which leads to being hit when your through the window and running 5-10 feet away already aka out of his range of attack but still gets the hit. So I say even tho it's free weekend currently at the time of this review. DON'T BOTHER WITH THIS POS GAME.
Game is pretty good

There is some mixed love and hate out there for this game. I'll be upfront in saying that it still has some problems. At the time of this review, the game was version 1.0.2 so there's still a lot of bugs to be fixed. With that said, nothing I've encountered so far has made the game unplayable. Slow and unbalanced match making is the biggest issue for me at the moment.

Survivor - Each match is a thriller. The already tense atmosphere tighten when the killer comes in range. After that it's a frantic sprint trying to shake a serial killer off your trail and hide again. Your companions can be helpful and take you off the killer's hook, heal you, or try and lure the killer away. Or they can be dicks and completely ignore you as your life blood waters the corn rows beneath the meat hook you're impaled on. Matches as a survivor are always a rush. The only problem I see so far is that it's extremely hard to rank up as a survivor vs a killer in my experience. 

Killer - Take your pick: Bear trapping psycho, stealthy wraith, or sprinting chain saw murderer. They're all fun and have different strategies to hunt down your prey. The less the survivors work together, the easier it is for you to pick them off one by one. Definitely a nice change of pace when you're tired of running for your life and want to do some of the executing. Since you need 4 survivors to 1 killer, it obviously takes longer to queque up. Seems to be easier too, the only time I don't rank up in the match is one when of the survivors disconnects and robs me of the points I'd glean from ruthlessly hunting them down. You can't spell slaughter without laughter after all, and managing to crucify all four players on my sacrificial hooks puts a big old smile on my face.

I would totally recommend this game to anyone. Lots of fun.
The only thing that is bad is people always leaving and taking a long time for a match to start because of this.
love it to easy to kill

this is one of those games that makes it fun to be scared. super fun and only $20 i highly suggest buying.

Updating the review in the light of the recent news:
The developers of this game have a pretty consistent track record of not caring about their playerbase, and now have partnered with a company to sell some god damn NFTs.
That last bit broke the camel's back.

Old review from 2016:

Remember when this game exploded on YouTube and Twitch?
Well, it exploded for a reason. This is the first horror game that is very good at giving me the creeps.
The ambience is well made and is sustained for the entire game, both visually and auditory.

The Killer and the Survivors are balanced - well, usually, if you play as a 4v1 or 3v1.
Quickplay is fine, and certainly causes more (fitting/good!) discomfort/creep (noone to talk trash to :P), but you'll have more long-term fun when you get murdered by your friends.

For the Dev Team:
If possible, can you add partied matchmaking, or add at least some progression for killing your friends? Sure, you can play w/o the unlockable perks, but it would be nice to have.
Also, if you can, add the ability to cycle/select the killer, instead of defaulting the host to be the killer. Maybe not specifically for QuickPlay, but for private games. It would be so comfortable to not have to make a lobby when you want to be the killer (especially for those with rather slow pc's/ISP's)

TL;DR: If you plan on playing this game for a longer time, make sure your friends are also buying a copy.

My last review was when I had 20 hours into the game, here I am at 536 hours and still playing.

Send help, I've lost everything. My wife, my kids, my house, all I have left is Dead by Daylight and the Entity.

This game is incredibly fun.
I have over 250 hours since release and many more to come.
There are still a few balance issues to be dealt with and the implementation of 'survive with friends' but I feel the devs are on the ball, listen to the community and we've already had 2 big patches with lots of content and I'm very excited about the future of the game.
It does still need tweaking, but overall for the price and the absolute intensity and fun of the game I can do nothing but recommend it.

This game has a terrible amount of bp requirement to acquire skill.
So I lose interest and turn off the game.
 It is difficult to collect bp, but this game does not improve the bp problem
The game tries to solve the problem of bp requirement with additional skill, and it also cuts it to half.
David was cut in half because he is a free character.
Although bbq is a much more powerful skill, it does not shred trash characters in half because people are spending money to get bbq.
There seems to be no fundamental solution.
Yes, and David's bp bonus skills were cut in half.
The hook-breaking score was also cut in half.
The map reconnaissance score was also cut by more than half.
Developers do not know how painful it is because they have never done bp
They seem to think like this.
The more difficult it is to collect bp, the more you will be playing this game!
And you will inevitably buy dlc.
I paid enough to play this game.
This game requires more money with the ongoing release of dlc.
The problem with bp has not been improved at all
The dlc will continue to be created and the demand bp will increase further.
You need to buy all dlc to get this game right.
And you have to buy bp and is to get bp as a purchase of duplicate skill and grow another character.
And there is a reincarnation system.
How can you make a game like this?

I cant really recommend this, it is kinda fun the first couple of rounds, even if you lose.  But it gets old by your third game.
I'd compare this game to Amnesia, which was brilliant.  But having a player as the killer just doesn't make it scarey.  Perhaps if I played it with friends then yes, but lets be honest, 90% of the time you are playing with randoms.

I literally bought this game to play with my friend(s) and you can't even do that. What kind of multiplayer game doesn't have a system where you can invite your friends and enjoy yourself? I don't recommend purchasing until they add a very simple invite feature.

Este jogo é bem legal. Tem uma proposta interessantes e dá muiiita tensão. No inicio da medo, mas com a jogatina voce vai ficar mais tenso mesmo. No momento desta análise nao foi lançado o modo de ir ranked com amigos, mas eles disseram que iriam lançar no futuro breve. O problema são alguns bugs que podem ocorrer, como voce ficar travado num pedaço de toco ou simplesmente voce ser desconetdado da partida.
No fim, o jogo ta bacana, mas se começar a ter novos assassinos e novos personagens ai ficaria Excelente.
Caso tenha amigos, a vida utíl se extende muito.
Nota: 8/10

Worst $16 I've ever spent. Laggy, slow, and the killer has way too many advantages. People constantly quit, the killer camps the hooks after hanging a player causing a lot of them to quit as soon as they are hooked. The killer hosts the game on his turbo potato PC so the quality of the entire game is dependent on that. It also has a ton of bugs that cause you to die almost instantly

On m'as beaucoup parlé de Dead By Daylight et pourtant j'ai beaucoup hésité.. Et bien je ne regrette clairement pas cet achat, je pensais m'amuser deux trois parties avant de décrocher mais au final on a toujours envie de lancer une nouvelle partie afin de s'améliorer ! Parce que chaque partie est différente et il faut s'adapter ! Les maps tournent et sont générée semi-procéduralement, et surtout en fonction du tueur qui vous traque et de vos coéquipier la facon dont va se dérouler la partie va être très différente ! 

Est ce que le tueur va vous traquer un par un et vous sacrifier sur un autel ? Va-t-il vous laisser ramper un à un dans l'espoir d'une sortie ? Va-t-il machiavéliquement regarder votre ami souffrir sur l'autel alors que vous n'attendez qu'une chose : qu'il s'en aille pour sauver votre ami ?
Quand à vos "coéquipiers", vont-ils vous aider quand vous serez en galère ou vont ils fuir ? Vont-ils narguer le tueur afin que vous puissiez vous échapper ou vont-ils se faire bêtement avoir et mourrir avec vous ?

Tant de possibilité et de rejouabilité font que l'on a vraiment envie de devenir meilleur !
Et les "arbres de compétences" sortent du commun avec un système d'"arbre de loot" générés aléatoirement et qu'il faudra compléter pour level up et débloquer de nouvelles compétences qui vous aideront peut-être à mieux vous en sortir la prochaine fois ! Plus les niveaux passe et plus le jeu devient stratégique et malsain !
